Minor editorial changes have been made throughout this IRM. Also, website addresses and references were reviewed and updated as necessary.
This material supersedes IRM 4.10.16, dated January 02,

Employees in the Small Business and Self-Employed (SB/SE), Large Business and International (LB&I), and Governmental Entities (TE/GE), and Wage and Investment (W&I) operating divisions who of income tax returns (Forms 1040, 1120, 1120S, and 1065).

Operational Automation Database (EOAD)

) EOAD provides data that tracks examination results by issue. This used to enhance the ability to identify specific areas of non-compliance Operational on examination results and track the effectiveness of the examination cation process. EOAD is used to track examination results for National Research Project (NRP) examinations and analyzed by the countability Office (GAO) and Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (TIGTA) as part of their audits of IRS examination addition, EOAD data is used to fulfill disclosure of examination results agreements with state and local taxation agencies. Therefore, it is that data inputs are accurate. (

S, and
using Report Software (RGS) and Issue Management System (IMS) software. (

) Contacts screen - captures identification and contact information for the preparer and representative(s). The proper completion of this information allows the ability to identify and address egregious return preparers. (
) The examiner creates issues in RGS using the drop down “Actions” menu to select the option that best describes the issue. The menu options are: (cid:

) New Issue – This is an issue that has been identified by the examiner has determined that it warrants additional inspection. New Issues are not Classified Issues nor are they directly related to a Classified Issue. (cid:

) New Classified Issue – This is an issue that has been identified through the issue classification process and appears on a Classification Check Sheet. All Classified Issues must be added and commented upon even if they are subsequently declassified. If a Classified Issue is declassified, check the declassified box on the issue adjustment screen. Add an ment record with the issue categorized as though it was examined. Enter the issue amount from the return in both the Per Return and Per Exam fields and select a Declassified Issue Reason Code. (cid:

) New Issue Resulting From Classified Issue – This is an issue that can be directly traced back to a classified issue. For example, a classified balance sheet item could lead to one or more profit and loss items. These subsequent Profit and Loss issues would be identified as New Issue Resulting From Classified Issue. (cid:

) New Mandatory Issue – There are as many as eleven mandatory issues for business cases that are auto-generated when the case file is created RGS. Mandatory Issues, such as for changes to income or cost of sales, should never be used to report adjustments. Note: Issues from different lines on a tax return must be created separately using the appropriate issue code and should not be combined.

) Once issues are identified, the Issue Adjustment screen is accessed using “Add” function box. (
) To promote accuracy and reduce time spent, EOAD fields should be concurrently with the examination of issues to the greatest extent possible. (

) The following fields are captured by EOAD on the Issue Adjustment screen: a. Categorization - this selection determines how RGS will calculate the resulting from the adjustment. A “RGS Issue Reference Guide” is for download at the RGS website http://mysbse.web.irs.gov/examination/ rgs/resources/

aspx. This guide provides detailed instructions to examiners on how to properly categorize an adjustment based upon the IMF Issue Code selection to ensure RGS performs a proper tax calcula- tion and that accurate EOAD data is captured. b. Per return, Per exam amounts. c. Reason Code – a two-digit code that identifies the reason for the adjust- ment, why the issue was no changed, or declassified. The examiner should follow the drop down menus in RGS to select the code that best describes the reason the issue was or was not adjusted. See Exhibit

(MM-DD-YYYY) Note: Adjustments to Earned Income Credit issues or originating from Flow Through Entities require the selection of specific Reason Codes. Reason Codes for adjustments from Flow Through Entities are further divided to identify the case as either NRP or Non NRP. For all other issues, select the code that best fits the reason the issue was or was not adjusted. d. Uniform Issue List (UIL) Code - SB/SE examiners are not required to complete this field. e. This code should be selected based the taxpayer’s largest source of wage income per exam regardless of the largest source is from the primary or secondary taxpayer. This field will completed where the taxpayer is both a wage earner and self-employed. If wages are earned, no code is entered. RGS provides a series of pull down menus to assist the examiner in selecting the correct code.

) Amount Paid at Closing – This is the total amount paid for the applicable period at the time the examination was concluded or before the case is closed from the group. (
) Study Type – This field will be left blank currently. It is a three-digit field will be used to track cases for special surveys or research studies (not the same as current project codes). (
) Upon completion of all fields, the Compliance Evaluation screen must be validated, saved, and printed. The printed copy must be placed in the case folder on top of the case file. (

) SB/SE and LB&I, International Individual Compliance (IIC) examiners will forward all closed cases by Local Area Network (LAN) unless that EOAD Data is unavailable. The EOAD data is included in the electronic case file by the forwarding process. (
) Forms
S, and
examinations which could not be completed using LAN-RGS must be notated as such on the Form
, Special Handling Notice for Examination Case Processing. Any cases not filling the requirements of IRM
, EOAD Data Capture Procedures, be returned to the originating examination group. (
) In
, LB&I fully implemented IMS and required its use on all cases by LB&I. As of

, the IMS system captures the EOAD data in a Data format that can be shared with state and local taxation agencies. a case is on IMS, the examiner no longer needs to copy cases to external media such as compact disks. (

) EOAD data is automatically extracted by IMS at case closure based upon examiners’ inputs on various IMS screens. Instructions detailing the proper input of data in IMS can be found in the IMS Client program. (
) For cases completed using IMS, EOAD data is included in the electronic file by the forwarding process. (
) If a disclosure is made to an agency whose code is manual or not with AIMS, or if the disclosure is of Non-Master File (NMF) information, the EOAD reporting will be done manually by preparing Form
-B, Multiple Disclosure. Additional information regarding disclosure reporting (CCP) can be found at IRM
, Recordkeeping and Accounting for sures. (
) State agency codes can be found in IRM Exhibit
, State Agency Codes. (
) Instructions for Form
-B, preparation can be found at IRM Exhibit
, Multiple Record of Disclosure.
